title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Enabled push protection for multiple secret scanning patterns (e.g., Atlassian, Databricks, Dropbox).
Updated GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) documentation: clarified that self-hosted runners are required, GitHub-hosted runners unsupported.
Removed "not in CIDR notation" note from larger runners' static IP documentation.
Announced sunset of Copilot Knowledge Bases (retiring Sep 12, 2025), replaced by Copilot Spaces; added expiration notices.
summary:
- Enabled push protection for multiple secret scanning patterns (e.g., Atlassian, Databricks, Dropbox).
- Updated GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) documentation: clarified that self-hosted runners are required, GitHub-hosted runners unsupported.
- Removed "not in CIDR notation" note from larger runners' static IP documentation.
- Announced sunset of Copilot Knowledge Bases (retiring Sep 12, 2025), replaced by Copilot Spaces; added expiration notices.

original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- Enabled push protection for multiple secret scanning patterns (e.g., Atlassian, Databricks, Dropbox).
- Updated GitHub Enterprise Server (GHES) documentation: clarified that self-hosted runners are required, GitHub-hosted runners unsupported.
- Removed "not in CIDR notation" note from larger runners' static IP documentation.
- Announced sunset of Copilot Knowledge Bases (retiring Sep 12, 2025), replaced by Copilot Spaces; added expiration notices.
